required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Impact of Hybrid Closed-loop Insulin Delivery in Type 1 Diabetes on Glycemic Control and PROMs
clinical_study.official_title: The Impact of Hybrid Closed-loop Insulin Delivery (Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G System) on Glycemic Control and Patient-reported Outcomes in People Living With Type 1 Diabetes: a Multicenter Real-world Observational Study in Belgium

brief_summary.textblock:
Since February 2019 the first hybrid closed-loop insulin pump, the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system, has been offered to people with type 1 diabetes in Belgium. Despite previous studies, the impact of this insulin pump on glycemic control and patient-reported outcomes (PROMs) is still unclear. Therefore, this study will evaluate the impact of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system on glycemic control and PROMs in people living with type 1 diabetes under real-life conditions. In a multicenter real-world observational study, 350 people with type 1 diabetes who are treated with the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system in one of 17 Belgian centers, will be followed for a period of 12 months. The primary endpoint is the evolution of time spent in range (defined as a sensor glucose value between 70 and 180 mg/dL) from before start to 12 months after start of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system.
Since not much is known about the impact of hybrid closed-loop on partners of adults living with type 1 diabetes, an optional substudy (INRANGE-PARTNER) will be performed investigating the quality of life in partners of type 1 diabetes patients using the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system. More specifically, the substudy will compare the quality of life of partners of type 1 diabetes patients both before and after implementation of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system.

primary_outcome.description: The evolution of percentage of time spent in range (sensor glucose 70-180 mg/dL) from before start to 12 months after start of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system

secondary_outcome.measure: Time in range
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from before start to 4, 8 and 12 months after start of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of time spent in range (sensor glucose 70-180 mg/dL), with exclusion of the primary endpoint

secondary_outcome.measure: Time in level 2 hypoglycemia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from before start to 4, 8 and 12 months after start of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of time spent in level 2 hypoglycemia (sensor glucose <54 mg/dL)

secondary_outcome.measure: Time in level 1 hypoglycemia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from before start to 4, 8 and 12 months after start of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of time spent in level 1 hypoglycemia (sensor glucose <70 mg/dL and ≥54 mg/dL)

secondary_outcome.measure: Time below range
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from before start to 4, 8 and 12 months after start of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of time spent below range (sensor glucose <70 mg/dL)

secondary_outcome.measure: Time above range
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from before start to 4, 8 and 12 months after start of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of time spent above range (sensor glucose >180 mg/dL)

secondary_outcome.measure: Time in level 1 hyperglycemia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from before start to 4, 8 and 12 months after start of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of time spent in level 1 hyperglycemia (sensor glucose >250 mg/dL)

secondary_outcome.measure: Glycemic variability
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from before start to 4, 8 and 12 months after start of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system
secondary_outcome.description: Glycemic variability: coefficient of variation (CV), standard deviation (SD) and mean amplitude of glycemic excursions (MAGE)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean glucose concentration
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from before start to 4, 8 and 12 months after start of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system
secondary_outcome.description: Mean glucose concentration

secondary_outcome.measure: HbA1c
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from before start to 4, 8 and 12 months after start of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system
secondary_outcome.description: Change in HbA1c

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between sex (male/female) and change in HbA1c
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from before start to 4, 8 and 12 months after start of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation between sex (male/female) and change in HbA1c

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between educational attainment (measured by a questionnaire with multiple options) and change in HbA1c
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from before start to 4, 8 and 12 months after start of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation between educational attainment (measured by a questionnaire with multiple options) and change in HbA1c

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between cohabitation (yes/no) and change in HbA1c
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from before start to 4, 8 and 12 months after start of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation between cohabitation (yes/no) and change in HbA1c

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between duration of diabetes (years) and change in HbA1c
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from before start to 4, 8 and 12 months after start of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation between duration of diabetes (years) and change in HbA1c

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between chronic diabetic complications (measured by a questionnaire with multiple options) and change in HbA1c
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from before start to 4, 8 and 12 months after start of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation between chronic diabetic complications (measured by a questionnaire with multiple options) and change in HbA1c

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between total daily dose of insulin (units per day) and change in HbA1c
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from before start to 4, 8 and 12 months after start of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation between total daily dose of insulin (units per day) and change in HbA1c

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of low glucose events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from before start to 4, 8 and 12 months after start of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system
secondary_outcome.description: Number of low glucose events (LGE, defined as sensor glucose values ≤54 mg/dL for at least 15 minutes, preceded by at least 30 minutes with sensor glucose values >54 mg/dL)

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of life measured by the Short Form Health Survey 36-item (SF-36) version 2 questionnaire (scale: 0 (low quality of life) - 100 (high quality of life))
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from before start to 4, 8 and 12 months after start of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of life measured by the Short Form Health Survey 36-item (SF-36) version 2 questionnaire (scale: 0 (low quality of life) - 100 (high quality of life))

secondary_outcome.measure: Hypoglycemia awareness measured by the Clarke hypoglycemia awareness survey (scale: unaware (≥4 times "R" or once "U") or aware (<4 times "R"))
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from before start to 4, 8 and 12 months after start of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system
secondary_outcome.description: Hypoglycemia awareness measured by the Clarke hypoglycemia awareness survey (scale: unaware (≥4 times "R" or once "U") or aware (<4 times "R"))

secondary_outcome.measure: Hypoglycemia awareness measured by the Gold-scale (scale: 1 (aware) - 7 (unaware))
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from before start to 4, 8 and 12 months after start of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system
secondary_outcome.description: Hypoglycemia awareness measured by the Gold-scale (scale: 1 (aware) - 7 (unaware))

secondary_outcome.measure: Fear of hypoglycemia measured by the Hypoglycemia Fear Survey, version II (HFS-II) questionnaire, behaviour (scale: 0 (less adapted behaviour) - 40 (more adapted behaviour))
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from before start to 4, 8 and 12 months after start of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system
secondary_outcome.description: Fear of hypoglycemia measured by the Hypoglycemia Fear Survey, version II (HFS-II) questionnaire, behaviour (scale: 0 (less adapted behaviour) - 40 (more adapted behaviour))

secondary_outcome.measure: Fear of hypoglycemia measured by the Hypoglycemia Fear Survey, version II (HFS-II) questionnaire, worry (scale: 0 (not worried) - 72 (very worried))
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from before start to 4, 8 and 12 months after start of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system
secondary_outcome.description: Fear of hypoglycemia measured by the Hypoglycemia Fear Survey, version II (HFS-II) questionnaire, worry (scale: 0 (not worried) - 72 (very worried))

secondary_outcome.measure: Distress due to diabetes measured by the Problem Areas In Diabetes survey, short form (PAID-SF) questionnaire (scale: 0 (no distress) - 20 (very distressed))
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from before start to 4, 8 and 12 months after start of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system
secondary_outcome.description: Distress due to diabetes measured by the Problem Areas In Diabetes survey, short form (PAID-SF) questionnaire (scale: 0 (no distress) - 20 (very distressed))

secondary_outcome.measure: Treatment satisfaction measured by the Diabetes Treatment Satisfaction Questionnaire, status (DTSQs. Scale: 0 (low satisfaction) - 36 (high satisfaction))
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from before start to 4, 8 and 12 months after start of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system
secondary_outcome.description: Treatment satisfaction measured by the Diabetes Treatment Satisfaction Questionnaire, status (DTSQs. Scale: 0 (low satisfaction) - 36 (high satisfaction))

secondary_outcome.measure: Treatment satisfaction measured by a self-developed questionnaire about expectations towards the use of the Medtronic MiniMed 670G system (multiple choice)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from before start to 4, 8 and 12 months after start of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system
secondary_outcome.description: Treatment satisfaction measured by a self-developed questionnaire about expectations towards the use of the Medtronic MiniMed 670G system (multiple choice)

other_outcome.measure: Composite endpoint of HbA1c and time in hypoglycemia <70 mg/dl
other_outcome.time_frame: from before start to 4, 8 and 12 months after start of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system
other_outcome.description: Composite endpoint of HbA1c and time in hypoglycemia <70 mg/dl

other_outcome.measure: Severe hypoglycemia
other_outcome.time_frame: from before start to 4, 8 and 12 months after start of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system
other_outcome.description: Frequency of severe hypoglycemia

other_outcome.measure: Diabetic ketoacidosis
other_outcome.time_frame: from before start to 4, 8 and 12 months after start of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system
other_outcome.description: Frequency of diabetic ketoacidosis

other_outcome.measure: Hospital visits and/or admissions
other_outcome.time_frame: from before start to 4, 8 and 12 months after start of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system
other_outcome.description: Number of hospital visits and/or admissions because of severe hypoglycemia or diabetic ketoacidosis

other_outcome.measure: Work and school absenteeism
other_outcome.time_frame: from before start to 4, 8 and 12 months after start of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system
other_outcome.description: Work and school absenteeism (number of days that a patient was unable to attend work/school due to his/her diabetes (excluding consultation))

other_outcome.measure: (Unplanned) contacts with the diabetes team
other_outcome.time_frame: from before start to 4, 8 and 12 months after start of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system
other_outcome.description: Frequency of (unplanned) contacts with the diabetes team

other_outcome.measure: Change in total daily dose of insulin (units/day)
other_outcome.time_frame: from before start to 4, 8 and 12 months after start of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system
other_outcome.description: Change in total daily dose of insulin (units/day)

other_outcome.measure: Change in body weight (kilograms)
other_outcome.time_frame: from before start to 4, 8 and 12 months after start of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system
other_outcome.description: Change in body weight (kilograms)

other_outcome.measure: Time in Manual Mode
other_outcome.time_frame: only measured at month 4, 8 and 12 after start of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system
other_outcome.description: Percentage of time spent in Manual Mode

other_outcome.measure: Time in Auto Mode
other_outcome.time_frame: only measured at month 4, 8 and 12 after start of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system
other_outcome.description: Percentage of time spent in Auto Mode

other_outcome.measure: Indications for use of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system measured by a self-developed questionnaire (multiple options (non-ordinal))
other_outcome.time_frame: from before start to 4, 8 and 12 months after start of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system
other_outcome.description: Indications for use of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system measured by a self-developed questionnaire (multiple options (non-ordinal))

other_outcome.measure: Patients who stop
other_outcome.time_frame: only measured at month 4, 8 and 12 after start of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system
other_outcome.description: Number of patients who stop with the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system

other_outcome.measure: Reasons for discontinuation of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system measured by a self-developed questionnaire (multiple choice)
other_outcome.time_frame: only measured at month 4, 8 and 12 after start of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system
other_outcome.description: Reasons for discontinuation of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system measured by a self-developed questionnaire (multiple choice)

other_outcome.measure: Quality of life in partners of T1D patients using the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system measured by the SF-36 version 2 questionnaire. Note: only in case of substudy
other_outcome.time_frame: from before start to 12 months after start of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system
other_outcome.description: Quality of life in partners of T1D patients using the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system measured by the SF-36 version 2 questionnaire. Note: only in case of substudy

other_outcome.measure: Difference in quality of life in partners of T1D patients before and after implementation of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system, measured by the SF-36 version 2 questionnaire. Note: only in case of substudy

other_outcome.description: Difference in quality of life in partners of T1D patients before and after implementation of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system, measured by the SF-36 version 2 questionnaire. Note: only in case of substudy

other_outcome.measure: Difference in quality of life in partners of T1D patients before and after implementation of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system, measured by the DIDP-FM questionnaire. Note: only in case of substudy
other_outcome.time_frame: from before start to 12 months after start of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system
other_outcome.description: Difference in quality of life in partners of T1D patients before and after implementation of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system, measured by the DIDP-FM questionnaire. Note: only in case of substudy

other_outcome.measure: Correlation between 'quality of life of T1D patients using the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system' and 'quality of life in partners of T1D patients', both measured by the SF-36 version 2 questionnaire. Note: only in case of substudy
other_outcome.time_frame: from before start to 12 months after start of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system
other_outcome.description: Correlation between 'quality of life of T1D patients using the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system' and 'quality of life in partners of T1D patients', both measured by the SF-36 version 2 questionnaire. Note: only in case of substudy

other_outcome.measure: Correlation between composite endpoint 'HbA1c and time in hypoglycemia <70 mg/dL' and 'quality of life in partners of T1D patients using the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system', the latter being measured by the SF-36 version 2. Note: substudy only
other_outcome.time_frame: from before start to 12 months after start of the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system

arm_group.arm_group_label: type 1 diabetes patients using Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G
arm_group.description: Patients with type 1 diabetes, aged 18 years or older, who start with the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system (as part of routine clinical practice) in one of the 17 participating centers and who signed informed consent are eligible to participate. The decision about which patient to start, is left to the clinical judgement of the treating health care professional.

intervention.description: The Medtronic MinimedTM 670G system is a form of hybrid closed-loop insulin delivery. The Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system automatically adjusts basal insulin every five minutes based on CGM readings to reach a glucose target of 120 mg/dL, the SmartGuardTM Auto Mode. Patients still need to enter their carbohydrate intake and administer meal-time and correction boluses. Before Auto Mode is introduced, the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system has to be worn in Manual Mode. In contrast to Auto Mode, Manual Mode features an insulin stop up to 30 minutes before or when reaching preset low limits (suspend before/on low) and an automatic insulin restart when blood sugar levels recover. During Manual Mode the pump 'becomes familiar with' the daily insulin need of the patient. This information will be used when in Auto Mode.
intervention.arm_group_label: type 1 diabetes patients using Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G

study_pop.textblock: Participants will be recruited at the Diabetes departments of 17 diabetes convention hospitals in Belgium

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients with type 1 diabetes
- patients aged 18 years or older
- patients starting with the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system (as part of routine clinical practice) in one of the 17 participating centers. Note: the decision about which patient to start, is left to the clinical judgement of the treating health care professional.
- patients who signed informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients without type 1 diabetes
- patients under 18 years of age
- patients not starting with the Medtronic MiniMedTM 670G system in one of the 17 participating centers
- patients who did not sign informed consent

facility.name: CHU de Liège - site du Sart Tilman
